document.docAuthor: Heyer, Jacob Den & Castro, Tatiane Marie Martins Gomes De
document.docTitle: Riscus austroamericanus Den Heyer, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New Neotropical cunaxine species (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Neotropical cunaxine species (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae)

mods:name.mods:namePart: Castro, Tatiane Marie Martins Gomes De

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined:
1 female
holotype ,
Coffea arabica
L., Quillabamba, Cuzco, Peru (
12 ° 5 ' 19.6” S
/
72 ° 42 ' 13.3” W
), A.D.G. Alvarado,
04-VII- 2006
; 1 paratype tritonymph,
Solanum nigrum
L., Quillabamba, Cuzco, Peru (
12 ° 5 ' 19.6” S
/
72 ° 42 ' 13.3” W
), A.D.G. Alvarado,
4 -VII- 2006
; 1 paratype female,
Coffea arabica
L., Quillabamba, Cuzco, Peru (
12 ° 5 ' 19.6” S
/
72 ° 42 ' 13.3” W
), A.D.G. Alvarado,
04-VII- 2007
; 1 paratype female,
Euterpe
sp., Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil (
8 ° 02' S
/
40 ° 01' W
), Gondim Jr, M. G. C.,
5 -I- 1999
, slide MZLQ 3050 ; 1 paratype female, 1 paratype deutonymph,
Pisidium guajava Ilhéus
, Bahia, Brazil (
13 ° 01'S
/
40 ° 01'W
),
31 -VII- 2007
, A.R. Oliveira.

Dorsum (
Fig. 39
a,b & 41 a–c). The demarcation of the propodosomal shield is very vague (
Fig. 39
a & b). The same is true for the integumental striae. Only one very finely reticulate propodosomal shieldlike area (
Fig. 41
a) on the idiosoma : it bears setal pairs ve and sci as well as sensilla pairs vi and sce (
Figs 41
b&c, respectively); the latter are the longest sensillae. Except for setae sci all dorsal setae are rather short. Setae h 1 are the longest hysterosomal setae.

Venter (
Fig. 40
a, b). As with the dorsum hysterogastral “shields” and striae are poorly defined. Setae pcs (= paracoxal seta) occur on the median margin of coxae IV. Three pairs of hysterogastral setae. The genital area (
Fig. 42
) is recognised by the 5 pairs of g-setae. A pair of paragenital setae occur laterally to the anterior half of the genital region. The chelicera possesses a near terminal seta. The length ratio width:length of the hypognathum is 1 : 1.5

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 39–40b .
Riscus austroamericanus Den Heyer & Castro
sp. nov. Female. Dorsum (39a); posteriodorsal region of idiosoma (39b); venter (40a); posterioventral region of idiosoma (40b). UMB = 100 μm.

FIGURE 41 .
Riscus austroamericanus Den Heyer & Castro
sp. nov. Female. Propodosomal region, dorsal view (40a); sensillum vi (41b); sensillum sce (41c). UMB = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs (
Figs. 45–48
). Leg chaetotaxy: coxae
I – IV 3
sts, 1 peg – 1 sts – 3 sts – 1 sts; trochanters
I – IV 1 – 1
– 2 – 1 sts; basifemora
I – IV 3 – 3
– 2 – 1 sts; telofemora
I – IV 4 – 4
– 4 – 4 sts; genua I – IV { 2 asl}, { 1 asl, 1 sts}, 1 longish asl, 4 sts – 2 asl, 5 sts – 1 asl, 5 sts – 1 asl, 5 sts; tibiae I – IV { 2 asl, 1 sts}(
Fig 45
b), 4 sts – 1 asl, 5 sts – 1 bsl, 5 sts – 1 T, 3 sts; tarsi
I – IV 3
asl, { 1 asl, 1 sts, 1 fmls}, 1 dtsl, 2 tsl, 15 or 16 sts – 1 bsl, 1 dtsl, 1 tsl, 16 or 17 sts – 1 tsl, 14 or 15 sts – 15 or 16 sts.

Remarks. Differences between the two known species of
Riscus
shown in
Table 4
.
